intro: Chaerophyllum chilense, commonly known as the Chilean cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
